newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN OLOS SOAR, SPREAD WIDENS BUT AUCTION LOOMS.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN OLOS SOAR, SPREAD WIDENS BUT AUCTION LOOMS.

text.p: Belgian OLOs climbed sharply across the yield curve on Thursday after the Bundesbank cut its repo rate by a surprise 30 basis points to 3.00 percent and the Belgian central bank followed swiftly with its own rate cuts.

The benchmark 2006 OLO yield tumbled to 6.56 percent from 6.64. Its spread over German paper narrowed by two basis points to 28 -- a result, dealers said, of the Belgian franc's ability to hold onto early strength after the domestic rate move.
However, dealers did not rule out some spread widening again in the days to come, with the prospect of the Treasury's monthly OLO auction looming on Monday.
"Our currency appreciated. That's why the spread came down today, but it should widen before Monday," one dealer said. The franc rose to 20.5970/90 to the mark from 20.6010/30 on Wednesday.

Belgian bond futures closed 0.61 point up at 116.56 after hitting a contract high of 116.64. One dealer said the market had escaped profit-taking because "a lot of people were taken aback at the size of the German rate cut."
The National Bank lopped 20 basis points off its central rate -- bringing it back to parity with the German repo -- and the same amount off its end-day-rate, taking that to 4.25.
Belgian money market yields fell as soon as the Bundesbank move raised expectations of a domestic rate reduction.
Most dealers expected a Belgian cut of 10 to 20 bps. One said he felt happier the central rate was at parity again with the German repo after standing at a discount for several months.
The front-month Bibor future contract stood at the session high of 96.78, rising from 96.57.

One-week repos dropped after the Bundesbank move and closed at 3.03/08 percent, down from 3.22/24 on Wednesday. Three-month T-bill yields fell to 3.10/14 from 3.25/31 the previous session. -- Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6810, Fax +32 2 230 7710
